p: Furthermore, fractionation and purification of L. radiata extract resulted in isolation of an alkaloid, lycorine which was assessed as an anti-SARS-CoV component. The compound with an EC 50 value of 15.7 ± 1.2 nM and CC 50 value of 14980.0 ± 912.0 nM in cytotoxicity assay. Lycorine was found to inhibit viral replication at a concentration that is lower than that of glycyrrhizin. The results suggested that the phytochemical compound lycorine is a promising candidate for the development of new anti-SARS-CoV drugs in the treatment of SARS (Li et al., 2005c).
